It's Half-Life 2. What do you expect? The critically acclaimed sequel to a critically acclaimed shooter. It's got solid gameplay even now 18 years since release, it's legal to fuck a copy of the game, so go find a physical disk to stick you knob into.

Sure, the physics puzzles seem quaint in todays day and age where physics is used in everything from props to cloth, there's not much exciting about them, but they still add to the gameplay, and break up sections nicely, though they might stop the flow a bit too hard in some sections. (Cough, dropping a dishwasher to build a ramp.. cough)

Still, a good game that you should play to understand how FPS games have devolved over the years. Movement is probably the more solid and precise in HL2 than most modern games, which is a crazy thing to think about.

Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
¬Ω tsp bicarbonate of soda
¬º tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, ¬Ω tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¬º tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8‚Äì10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If you‚Äôve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don‚Äôt leave them too long or they‚Äôll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking
over hyped but good I guess

The Game Has A Great Story Even The Original One It Goes Like This. You're A 27 Year Old Man Who Graduated From Some Pretty Nerdy Stuff Then Gets Hired As A Scientist In The Iconic Black Mesa Research Facility. You're Part Of A Team That Test Samples From Alien Planets. But A Mysterious Man Named Gman Tells One Of The Researchers That "There Will Be Consequences" Then Gives Him The Sample. Gordon Freeman Puts The H . E . V  Mark 4 Suit On Then Goes To the Test Chamber But Oh No The Portal Rifts Between Earth And Alien Planets Causing Chaos! A Few Hours Later The Military Shows Up The Black Mesa Staff Thinking That They Will Save Them. But The Gman Says Otherwise Then Gordon Fights To The Surface Only To Realize That The V-22 Osprey Had Destroy The Surface. So Gordon Goes A Different Route. So Freeman Goes Through The Rail Road Beneath Then A Bunch Of Stuff Happen Like Black Ops Fighting The Military Or Aliens Killing Who Senses Who. Then Gordon Goes To A Portal To Go To Xen And Fight The NINALINTH Then You See Gman He Gives You A Offering Because He Was Impressed. Years Later The Combine Then Take Over The World By The Administrator Of Black Mesa Dr Breen. Gman Then Wakes Up Gordon Freeman And Tells Him That He Needs To Save The World. So Gordon Goes To City 17 When He Stumbles Upon Two Old Friends And A Engineer Who Has A Really Cool Robot. Gordon Is Then Told To Head To Black Mesa East To Meet UP With His Old Friends When He Arrives He Was Forced To Go To A Zombie Infested Town Call "Ravenholm" Where He Meets Up With This Crazy Dude Who In The End Goes To Sacrifice To Help Gordon Escape Then He Moves To The Beach Where He Fights A Gunship And Go To Nova Prospket And Finds Alyx And Eli. Then Mossman Betrays Them By Taking Eli To Somewhere Then Gordon And Alyx Go To City 17. And The Fun Had Just Begun. The People Of City 17 Destroy The Combine Piece By Piece Until The Citadel Is The Only Thing Left Then Gordon Destroys The Teleport Thing And Gman Saves Him And Alyx

The End

Literalmente me qued√© dormido jugando esto, mejor compra HMCC y ponte a jugar Halo 2.
Me parece que es el juego m√†s sobrevalorado de la historia, El arsenal de armas es aburrido y hay una menor variedad de enemigos que en la primera entrega. La primera entrega de Half-life me parecio m√°s entretenida. no puedo recomendarte este juego a no ser que seas un fan a morir de Valve o te cause una curiosidad tal que no te puedas resistir a probarlo.
Good game, still is great compared to modern games now.

Still a thoroughly enjoyable game by modern standards. The set pieces and gunplay are great, but what keeps me coming back is groundedness and attention to detail in its environments. It's a feat that despite being extremely liner, the game world feels so organic and lived in.
Still holds up today as one of the best games ever released.

the best FPS game i've played in my life

el mejor juego de la historia, si estas jugando en 2022 este juegazo solo ponle mods para las graficas y dale, la historia es genial, todo pasa en la vista del jugador sin cinematicas que te saquen de la inmersion, otros juegos le copiaron eso como los bioshock pero los half life fueron los primeros, las armas son muy variadas y el arma de gravedad es la mejor arma creada en los videojuegos, el carisma de los personajes se siente y llegas a sentir empatia, la ia era muy buena en su tiempo pero los enemigos son faciles de eliminar por la poca vida que tienen, aun asi hay ocasiones en que estaras un rato atorado en alguna situacion de combate, lo unico malo es que no sabemos nada de gman y el hl3 no se ve ni cerca de salir, este es juego, junto con el doom original y el halo 2 son la trinidad de los fps
10/10
